1) symptomatic patients — shortness of breath, runny rose, cough, fever or sore throat — who work in group homes, shelters and correctional facilities, or as first responders or in COVID-19 enforcement; and

Travellers will need to complete an Alberta isolation questionnaire that details how they will follow mandatory isolation requirements. Provincial officials will follow up with travellers within 3 days to ensure they are following public health orders and have the information and support they need. 
Effective until:

Effective until:

Who: Ministry of Health, Government of Alberta
What: Defined an outbreak as 1 or more cases with COVID-19-like symptoms, including at least 1 laboratory-confirmed case in a facility/community with vulnerable people—e.g., First Nations community, shelter, hospital, long-term care facility, supportive living, lodge, seniors' residence or similar setting, any facility in which residential addiction treatment services are provided, daycare, correctional facility

description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Permitted preschool programs to reopen; facilities may operate with a maximum cohort of 10 people, including staff and children
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Expanded testing criteria to test all Albertans, whether they have COVID-19 symptoms or not
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Distributed 4 free non-medical masks per person at all A&W, McDonald’s Canada and Tim Hortons drive-through locations in Alberta, while supplies last. No purchase is necessary. The government is also working with municipalities, First Nations communities, Métis settlements and local agencies to distribute the non-medical masks to those who need them.
Effective until:

type: External Border Restrictions or Internal Border Restrictions
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Implemented enhanced border screening measures at the Alta./US border crossing at Coutts (busiest in the province and open 24 hours)
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Permanently amended regulations under the Nursing Homes Act to allow nurse practitioners to act as primary care providers in nursing homes, admitting and assessing residents, as well as offering follow-up care. Permanent changes also allowed nurse practitioners and other health professionals to prescribe medication and order treatments (e.g., common diagnostic tests, like X-rays, ultrasounds and CT scans) in nursing homes, according to their scopes of practice.
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Permitted K-12 schools to open for requested diploma exams and summer school
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Permitted to open with restrictions: libraries; indoor recreation, fitness and sports, including gyms and arenas; movie theatres and theatres; community halls; team sports; pools for leisure swimming; casinos and bingo halls (but not table games); and instrumental concerts; also lifted the 50% capacity limit for provincial campgrounds
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Permitted personal services (esthetics, cosmetic skin and body treatments, manicures, pedicures, waxing, facial treatment, artificial tanning) to open with restrictions
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Resumed additional surgeries; surgery type is unspecified in the relaunch plan
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Increased the limit on indoor social gatherings (e.g., wedding and funeral receptions and birthday parties) to 50 people and outdoor events and indoor seated/audience events (e.g., wedding and funeral ceremonies) to 100 people; physical distancing required. Gatherings at places of worship, restaurants, cafés, lounges and bars, casinos and bingo halls have no caps, provided that public health measures and physical distancing are in place. Households can increase their close interactions with other households to a maximum of 15 people.
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Released a comprehensive re-entry plan for the upcoming school year, which allows schools and parents to prepare for learning while putting student and staff safety first. The plan offers guidance on a wide range of operational issues including hygiene and health requirements, student learning, transportation and diploma exams. It also addresses mental health and psychological supports for students and staff.
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Increased the maximum cohort group size in child care centres from 10 to 30, including staff and children; health screening, cleaning, disinfecting and safe on-site practices will remain in place
Effective until:

Who: College and Association of Respiratory Therapists of Alberta
What: Released guidelines on safe resumption of service for respiratory therapists including cleaning practices, hand-washing, personal protective equipment, business practices, staff safety, communication
Effective until:
enforcer: College and Association of Respiratory Therapists of Alberta

description:
Who: Alberta College of Speech-Language Pathologists and Audiologists 
What: Updated safe practice guidelines for audiologists and speech-language pathologists to include a requirement for masks
Effective until:
enforcer: Alberta College of Speech-Language Pathologists and Audiologists

description:
Who: Alberta Dental Association and College
What: Released guidelines for safe reopening of dental offices 
Effective until:

type: Health Resources or Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Permitted massage, acupuncture and reflexology to open with restrictions
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: All regions in province, except Calgary and Brooks, entered Phase 1 of "Alberta's Relaunch Strategy."
Effective until: 2020-06-11

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Calgary and Brooks entered Phase 1 of "Alberta's Relaunch Strategy."
Effective until: 2020-06-11

Who: Government of Alberta
What: All regions in province entered Phase 2 of "Alberta's Relaunch Strategy."
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Extending supports to protect at-risk Albertans, which include $14.2 million a month in additional funding for enhanced staffing and extra cleaning supplies in long-term care, designated supportive living facilities and seniors lodges. The wage top-up of an additional $2 per hour for health care aides at contracting continuing care facilities will also continue.
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Increased the limit on outdoor gatherings up to 200 people or fewer for audience-type community outdoor events. The 100-person limit remains in place for other outdoor events and indoor seated/audience events. The limit for indoor social gatherings, including wedding and funeral receptions and birthday parties, remains at 50 people maximum. Gatherings remain subject to distancing measures.
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Provided 20 million masks to municipalities without easy access to a restaurant partner location; First Nations and Métis settlements; places of worship; transit services provincewide; seniors organizations and independent living facilities; long-term care and supportive living facilities; women’s shelters, homeless shelters and street outreach programs; addiction treatment centres; and other organizations that have highlighted a need for masks
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Released "Re-entry Toolkit" for K-12 students to return to daily learning, in person, at the beginning of the school year 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Updated visitation guidelines in continuing care facilities to allow visits from 2 designated family/support persons who are essential to maintaining resident mental and physical health
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Released a new online risk assessment tool to help people identify if they are at high risk of having a severe outcome; tool also provides information on how to mitigate that risk
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Updated plan and safety guidance for K-12 students to return to daily learning, in person, at the beginning of the school year 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Providing each of Alberta’s 5 First Nations colleges with $100,000 in 1-time funding for COVID-19 supports, for a total of $500,000. Part of the grant will assist with improved cleaning protocols to meet COVID-19 standards, address technology and Wi-Fi access, and support online programming development and delivery.
Effective until:

Who: Alberta Health
What: Resumed emergency pediatrician-provided services in South Health Campus (Calgary Zone); services had been suspended in Calgary Zone since early March
Effective until:

Who: Alberta College and Association of Chiropractors
What: Issued guidelines for chiropractors to meet the municipal requirements for indoor mask use and safety of clients and staff 
Effective until:
enforcer: Alberta College and Association of Chiropractors

description:
Who: Alberta Dental Association and College, College of Registered Dental Hygienists of Alberta
What: Released best practice guidelines for dental professionals for provision of safe care and reduced risk of infection
Effective until:
enforcer: Alberta Dental Association and College, College of Registered Dental Hygienists of Alberta

description:
Who: Government of Alberta, Premier, Chief Medical Officer of Health
What: Public health state of emergency expired, not renewed
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Alberta, Premier, Chief Medical Officer of Health

description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Recommended asymptomatic testing for all teachers and school staff prior to the start of the school year; other asymptomatic people asked to wait until 2020-09-01 to get tested, to ensure availability for teachers and staff
Effective until: 2020-09-01

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Opened 234 pharmacy testing centres (all Loblaw company owned locations)
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Updated visitation guidelines in continuing care facilities to use a risk-based approach for when residents move in or return after an outing: low-risk individuals have twice daily symptom checks; medium-risk individuals wear masks whenever outside of their residence room for 14 days; and high-risk individuals quarantine for 14 days
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Launched an online map, which lists all schools with an outbreak (2 or more confirmed cases within 14 days); map also shows schools that are open with near-normal operations (Scenario 1), and schools that shift into Scenario 2 (additional health measures, potential blended learning) or 3 (online learning)
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: AllowedAlbertans who have been COVID-19 tested through Alberta Health Services to get their results via SMS text or automated phone call
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta, Chief Medical Officer of Health
What: Permitted indoor hot tubs, dry saunas and steam saunas to open with cleaning and distancing restrictions
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Alberta, Chief Medical Officer of Health

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta, Chief Medical Officer of Health
What: Updated guidelines to permit limited band practices, singing and wind instrument concerts with rigorous and proper precautions
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Alberta, Chief Medical Officer of Health

description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Narrowed testing criteria to stop recommending testing to voluntary asymptomatic people; testing prioritized for symptomatic people, those in close contact with confirmed cases and targeted priority groups most likely to transmit COVID-19 to vulnerable populations
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Published resource toolkit with guidance for schools on re-entry Scenario 1 (in-person learning), COVID-19 outbreaks in school, school re-entry guidance and a fact sheet; face masks required when distancing cannot be maintained and students are outside of their cohort; physical distancing prioritized, encouraged cohort guidelines if physical distancing not possible; extra cleaning in place
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Mandated mask-wearing in schools for grades 4 to 12 students (with exceptions) in shared areas such as hallways and buses; masks not mandated when physical distancing is maintained
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Published resource toolkit: guide for COVID-19 outbreaks in school, school re-entry guidance and a fact sheet. Published symptoms for daily screening (fever, cough, shortness of breath/difficulty breathing, sore throat, chills, painful swallowing, runny nose/nasal congestion, feeling unwell/fatigued, nausea/vomiting/diarrhea, unexplained loss of appetite, loss of sense of taste or smell, muscle/joint aches, headache, conjunctivitis (pink eye). Students with pre-existing conditions that have similar symptoms to COVID-19 must test negative before school and then monitor for new or worsening symptoms daily. If a student becomes symptomatic at school, they get isolated in a different room and must wear a mask until they can be picked up.
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Announced that 20 community pharmacies have begun to offer testing to Albertans without symptoms and no known exposure to COVID-19, making it easier to access testing
Effective until:

Who: Alberta College of Occupational Therapists 
What: Updated previously published guidelines to add mask and personal protective equipment requirements for occupational therapists working in schools, early childhood services and preschool programs 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Defined an outbreak in a school as 2 or more confirmed cases (staff and/or student) within a 14-day period (1 incubation period) or 2 or more confirmed cases (staff and/or child) that are epidemiologically linked
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Recommended people living in the Edmonton zone to limit social and family gatherings to no more than 15 people and limit the number of cohorts per person to no more than 3 (a core/household cohort; a school cohort; and 1 additional sport, social or other cohort); young children who attend child care could be part of 4 cohorts, given that child care cohorts have not shown a high-risk of spreading COVID-19
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Implemented voluntary public health measures to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 in Edmonton zone; recommended wearing non-medical masks in all indoor work settings, except when alone in workspaces, such as offices or cubicles, and where separated from others or an appropriate barrier is in place
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Implemented appointment-only approach for Alberta Health Services assessment centres; drop-in options in Calgary and Edmonton no longer available
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Narrowed testing criteria to exclude asymptomatic people with no known exposure; existing appointments for asymptomatic people honoured until 2020-11-04
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta, Government of Canada
What: Launched a new pilot program in which international participating travellers returning to Canada through the Coutts land border crossing or the Calgary International Airport, receive a COVID-19 test upon entry into Canada and go into quarantine; once that test is negative, individuals are allowed to leave their place of quarantine so long as they commit to getting a second test 6 to 7 days after arrival and follow enhanced preventive health measures
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Alberta, Government of Canada

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Prohibited social gatherings of more than 15 people in the cities of Edmonton and Calgary; limit applies to gatherings such as dinner parties, wedding and funeral receptions, banquets and other gatherings but not structured events such as dining in restaurants, theatres, worship services or wedding and funeral ceremonies
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Removed runny nose and sore throat from the list of core symptoms requiring mandatory isolation for those under the age of 18; this change is only for those with no known exposure
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Prohibited residents of Edmonton and Calgary regions from holding social gatherings within their homes and instead instructed them to socialize in structured settings where it is easier to limit risk of exposure; expanded the mandatory 15-person limit on social gatherings to all communities on the watch list; recommended limiting cohorts to maximum 3
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Launched targeted contact tracing approach in which Alberta Health Services only directly notifies close contacts of confirmed COVID-19 cases in 3 priority groups: health care workers, minors (parents will still be notified if their child has been exposed in a school setting) and individuals who live or work within congregate or communal facilities; Albertans outside the priority groups who test positive asked to notify their own close contacts
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Mandated that all restaurants, bars, lounges and pubs in regions under enhanced status stop liquor sales by 10 p.m. and close by 11 p.m.
Effective until: 2020-11-27

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Prohibited indoor group fitness classes, team sport activities and group performance activities in Edmonton and surrounding areas, Calgary and surrounding areas, Grande Prairie, Fort McMurray, Red Deer and Lethbridge
Effective until: 2020-11-27

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Implemented new gathering restrictions and recommendations for all regions under "enhanced" status, including maximum attendance of 50 at wedding or funeral ceremonies; recommended all faith-based activities limit attendance to one-third capacity per service; residents encouraged not to hold social gatherings within their homes or plan social gatherings outside their community; recommended employers in office settings implement measures to reduce the number of employees in the workplace at 1 time
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
description:
Who: Chief Medical Officer of Health
What: Launched a new online portal that allows for automated texting of close contacts: Albertans who receive a positive COVID-19 result may enter information and phone numbers of known close contacts on the AHS website and submit this information; once reviewed by the contact tracing team, including with the case, the tool sends texts informing close contacts of their exposure (anonymously), instructing them to isolate immediately for 14 days and providing a link to further information on isolation requirements, testing options, symptoms and supports available
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Announced that 1.6 million reusable masks will be distributed to students and teachers (2 each) before the start of school
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Launched "COVID-19 relaunch status map" showing the level of risk in 142 regions and information about local health measures; regions are designated as 1 of 3 phases (open, watch, enhanced)
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: 89 regions (including Calgary and Edmonton) were in "enhanced" relaunch status
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Strongly recommended wearing masks in the workplace for any community on the watch list, regardless of location unless employees can distance safely
Effective until:

Who: Alberta Health Services
What: Released COVID-19 return-to-work guide for health care workers after having experienced symptoms, been tested for COVID-19 or been self-isolating
Effective until:

Who: College of Alberta Dental Assistants
What: Released dental practice guidelines to conduct safe care delivery and reduce infection rates
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Chief Medical Officer of Health
What: Announced that public schools would open for the first day of classes across the province. Dates vary across school boards. 
Effective until:

Who: Chief Medical Officer of Health 
What: Reduced scheduled/elective surgeries and procedures to increase COVID-19 patient intake capacity
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: The regions of Calgary, Edmonton and other specified regions of Alberta (for full list, refer to secondary source column) were moved to enhanced lockdown; limited restaurants, bars, pubs and lounges to no more than 6 people per table with distancing between tables, and stop liquor sales at 10 p.m.; all food and drink establishments must close at 11 p.m. with the exception of casinos; restricted retail, entertainment and event services to 25% capacity (e.g., grocery stores, clothing stores, movie theatres, libraries); closed in-person services (e.g., banquet halls, concert venues, conference centres, racing centres, indoor amusement parks); restricted personal and professional services (e.g., lawyers, accountants) to one-on-one appointment only
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: The regions of Calgary, Edmonton and other specified regions of Alberta (for full list, refer to secondary source column) were moved to enhanced lockdown; prohibited all indoor and outdoor children's play areas and all levels of sport (e.g., professional, junior, amateur) including community centres with outlined exemptions; restricted indoor fitness and recreation centres to 25% capacity (e.g., dance studio, gyms), with a prohibition on group activities 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Mandated home learning for K–6 between January 4 and 11 and for grades 7 to 12 between November 20 and January 11 for the entire province of Alberta; students who require in-person support that cannot be met through at-home learning are exempt; prohibited all levels of sport at collegiate and university level
Effective until: 2021-01-11

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: The regions of Edmonton, Calgary and specified enhanced regions of Alberta (for full list, refer to secondary source column) prohibited all indoor gatherings in public and private areas except with members of same household, co-parenting arrangements and service visits (e.g., caregivers, health care, childcare and home maintenance); outdoor gatherings are limited to 10 people with social distancing; festivals and events are all prohibited; individuals living alone may have up to 2 external close contacts exclusively; limited structured gatherings (e.g., weddings, funerals) to 10 people; public worship services are limited to 1/3 capacity with safety measures 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Recommended working from home, where possible for the province of Alberta 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta 
What: The regions of Calgary, Edmonton and surrounding areas mandated masks in all indoor workplaces and schools 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
description:
Who: Chief Medical Officer
What: Announced that in order to accommodate the backlog, contact tracers will only make calls to recently diagnosed patients and those in high-priority settings; those who are no longer infectious (i.e., Albertans who received a positive COVID-19 test result 10+ days ago) will receive text messages instead of phone calls to provide guidance and notify them of their isolation period ending 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta 
What: Expanded temporary authority of Alberta and community peace officers to enforce public health orders, which will increase the number of officers able to levy fines by about 700; not following mandatory restrictions could result in fines of $1,000 per ticketed offence and up to $100,000 through the courts
Effective until:

Who: Alberta Health Services
What: Launched a new rapid testing pilot program, which involves more than 100,000 tests from 2 point-of-care rapid testing systems; will be rolled out at various testing clinics across the province including Calgary and Edmonton clinics targeting the homeless population
Effective until:

Who: Chief Medical Officer of Health 
What: Limited visitor access to Alberta Health Services acute sites that are experiencing outbreaks and communities under enhanced status; hospital patients and ambulatory care visitors are limited to 1 person; maternity, pediatrics/neonatal intensive care unit and end of life visitors are limited to 2 people with permissions
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Released COVID-19 vaccine distribution implementation plan with 3 phases 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Announced the 1st phase of vaccination will target long-term care, designated supported living residents and staff, on-reserve First Nations individuals over 65 years of age, seniors age 75or older and health care workers most needed to ensure workforce capacity 
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Chief Medical Officer of Health 
What: Encouraged Albertans to prepare for a socially distanced holiday season, limiting family gatherings and holiday parties
Effective until:

Who: Chief Medical Officer of Health 
What: Hospitals in the Edmonton zone postponed 60% of non-urgent surgeries that require hospital stay; reduced clinical support services (e.g., diagnostic imaging) by 40% and reduced ambulatory visits and procedures 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta 
What: The entire province of Alberta moved to lockdown–enhanced 
Effective until: 2021-01-21

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: The province moved to lockdown–enhanced: prohibited indoor and outdoor service at restaurants, bars, lounges, cafes and other food and drink establishments; restricted retail services to 15% capacity or 5 customers; closed all personal and wellness services
Effective until: 2021-01-21

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: The province moved to lockdown–enhanced: prohibited indoor and outdoor sports and closed recreational centres including gyms and fitness studios; outdoor group physical activity limited to 10 people or fewer, highly recommended being within single households; limited performance activities such as dancing, theatre and musical instruments to a maximum of 2 people indoors and 10 people outdoors; closed all indoor and outdoor entertainment facilities such as casinos, libraries, raceways and movie theatres
Effective until: 2021-01-21

type: Health Resources or Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: The province moved to lockdown–enhanced: restricted regulated health professions (e.g., physicians, dentists, physiotherapists) and to one-on-one appointments only; closed non-regulated health services (e.g., massage therapy)
Effective until: 2021-01-21

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: The province moved to lockdown–enhanced: prohibited indoor and outdoor social gatherings in public and private areas, except with members of same household, co-parenting arrangements and service visits (e.g., caregivers, health care, childcare and home maintenance); individuals living alone may have up to 2 external close contacts exclusively; limited structured gatherings (e.g., weddings, funerals) to 10 people and public worship services to 15% capacity with safety measures
Effective until: 2021-01-21

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Mandated work-from-home order, unless employer requires physical operational effectiveness 
Effective until: 2021-01-21

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Mandated masks in all indoor public places except for safely distanced office cubicle spaces, farm operations and private residential rental accommodations
Effective until: 2021-01-21

type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Administered 1st COVID-19 vaccinations to a respiratory therapist and intensive care unit nurse in Calgary
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Launched COVID Care Teams in 11 communities in the Edmonton and Calgary regions, providing programs and supports (e.g., self-isolation hotels and culturally appropriate food free of charge for individuals in these areas who test positive for COVID-19) 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Purchase of COVID-19 vaccines or Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Received 1st shipment of 3,900 doses of Pfizer vaccine
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Strongly encouraged all travellers returning to Alberta from the United Kingdom in the last 14 days to get tested, including those participating in the Alberta Border pilot program, regardless of whether they've had a negative test; traveller will be contacted by Alberta Health Services to book a test; all travellers must immediately quarantine
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Chief Medical Officer of Health
What: Allowed an individual living alone to join a household for 1 gathering during December 23 to 28; the household must be limited to 2 adults and must remain socially distant 
Effective until: 2020-12-28

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Strongly encouraged all travellers returning to Alberta from South Africa since December 7 to get tested, including those participating in the Alberta Border pilot program, regardless of whether they've had a negative test; traveller will be contacted by Alberta Health Services to book a test; all travellers must immediately quarantine
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Purchase of COVID-19 vaccines or Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Received 1st shipment of 16,900 doses of Moderna vaccine
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Winter breaks in Alta. regions follow the same schedule
Effective until: 2021-01-01

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Issued order allowing pharmacists, dental hygienists and assistants, and dieticians to perform nasopharyngeal swabs to test for COVID-19
Effective until:

Who: Alberta Health Services
What: Released COVID-19 immunization information package for health professionals, which includes information on vaccine handling, storage and administration 
Effective until:

Who: Alberta Health Services 
What: Released guide on resources for primary care physicians to support COVID-19 care in communities
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Alberta COVID-19 Dashboard includes vaccination progress to date
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Alberta 
What: Permitted personal, wellness and professional services to open by appointment only
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Announced terminology alert system change for schools affected by COVID-19 where the category "watch" will no longer be used; schools are described as either "alert" (1 to 4 cases) or "outbreak" (5-plus cases) 
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Alberta
What: Permitted outdoor social gatherings of up to 10 people; increased funeral ceremony attendance to 20 people 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Announced returning travellers from the UK and South Africa are no longer eligible to participate in the border pilot program and must quarantine in their homes after entering the province 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta
What: Announced all border pilot participants must remain in quarantine until receiving a negative test result from their 2nd COVID test on day 7 or 8 (when arrival day is day 1); current participants must return to quarantine if they haven't received a 2nd negative result; participants cannot return to child care, out-of-school care, schools, post-secondary institutions and workplaces outside of their home for 14 days
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings

Who: Alberta Health Services
What: Introduced an additional 14-day quarantine for household members of individuals with positive variant cases. This would take effect as soon as the variant case has completed their 10-day self isolation. If the variant case self-isolated at home instead of a hotel, all members of the household would quarantine for 24 days total. 
Effective until:

Effective until:

Who: Alberta Health Services
What: Expanded government support for self-isolation: upon referral from Alberta Health Services, anyone (including First Nations individuals on and off reserve) who cannot safely isolate at home is eligible for up to 14 free days in a hotel room; prior to this expansion, only Calgary and Edmonton residents were eligible
Effective until:

Who: Government of Alberta, Chief Medical Officer of Health

enforcer: Government of Alberta, Chief Medical Officer of Health

Recommended testing for the following if they develop a fever and onset of cough or shortness of breath: health care workers; residents of remote, isolated or Indigenous communities; people living and working in congregate settings; people who are homeless or have unstable housing; essential service workers; returning travellers.

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Ministry of Education
What: Updated operational guidelines for school districts to ensure a consistent provincewide approach to keep schools safe. Masks are required for staff, middle and secondary students in high-traffic areas such as buses and in common areas such as hallways, or anytime outside of their learning group whenever physical distancing cannot be maintained. Elementary school students are not required to wear masks. Additional safety measures include setting up classrooms to promote spacing between students and practising physical distancing outside of learning groups. 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)

description:
