type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Permitted work environments that offer the public outdoor recreational or sports activities to reopen with the exception of beaches, water parks and spas 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Presented a plan for residential and long-term care centres, which will allow residents to go out without supervision from the facility, to stay outside the facility for more than 24 hours, to receive visits and to meet people outside as well as participate in indoor and outdoor group activities, under certain conditions
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec (OPPQ) 
What: Announced that registrants must now reference external health protocols (Commission des normes, de l'équité, de la santé et de la sécurité du travail and Institut national de santé publique du Québec) during face-to-face interactions; earlier health and safety guidelines from OPPQ are no longer in effect
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec (OPPQ)

description:
Who: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec 
What: Issued statement that because patients must wear masks, registrants who have to provide a patient with a mask are permitted to incorporate personal protective equipment fees into their service fees, within reason
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec

description:
Who: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec 
What: Updated guidance for in-person treatment of specific clientele, including health care workers (dependent on if they used personal protective equipment in all clinical interactions in the past 14 days), cross-border truckers (treat the same as any other patient) and those over the age of 70 (telerehabiliation is preferable)
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec

description:
Who: Ordre des chiropraticiens du Québec 
What: Published checklist of mandatory and recommended guidelines for chiropractic clinic setup and safety of staff and clients
Effective until:

Who: Ordre des dentistes du Québec, Ordre des optométristes du Québec, Ordre des pharmaciens du Québec
What: Published guidance for dentists, optometrists and pharmacists to limit hand-to-hand circulation of paper prescriptions to control infection transmission 
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre des dentistes du Québec, Ordre des optométristes du Québec, Ordre des pharmaciens du Québec

description:
Who: Ordre des infirmières et infirmiers du Québec
What: Published guidelines for nurses to deliver safe and appropriate care using telepractice
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre des infirmières et infirmiers du Québec

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Permitted indoor gatherings of 10 people or fewer from a maximum of 3 households in the metropolitan community of Montréal, the regional county municipality of Joliette and the city of L'Épiphanie 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Released plan for deconfinement — the gradual reopening and resumption of services
Effective until:

Who: Office of the Premier
What: Entered Phase 1 of the deconfinement plan
Effective until: 2020-05-10

Who: Office of the Premier
What: Entered Phase 2 of the deconfinement plan
Effective until: 2020-05-19

Who: Office of the Premier
What: Entered Phase 3 of the deconfinement plan
Effective until: 2020-05-24

Who: Office of the Premier
What: Entered Phase 4 of the deconfinement plan
Effective until: 2020-05-31

Who: Office of the Premier
What: Entered Phase 5 of the deconfinement plan
Effective until:

Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-06-30
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Permitted opening of all activity sectors that cannot be carried out remotely (amusement parks, spas, bars, casinos, accommodation establishments, gaming houses, professional sports) under certain conditions; does not include festivals and major events, overnight holiday camps and combat sports
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Permitted gatherings of 50 people or fewer in indoor public places including places of worship, theatres and community halls with distancing measures in place
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Increased the capacity limit in child care centres in the region of Montréal, Joliette and the territory of Ville de L'Épiphanie to 75% of the maximum number of children indicated in the child care centre permit
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Permitted caregivers, companions or visitors to hospital centres at any time of the patient's stay and for all sectors: hospital visiting hours must be respected; only 1 person for the same time slot is authorized, for a maximum of 4 people per 24-hour period; specific conditions apply to emergency rooms, oncology and obstetrics sectors
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency 
Effective until: 2020-07-08
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Lifted suspension on the organization of summer schools and local and ministerial examinations for secondary 4 and 5 students
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Mandatedwearing a face cover or mask in public transport for people 12 years of age and older; a transitional period of 2 weeks from the date of implementation given to put the measure in place
Effective until:

Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Amended employment conditions for non-unionized salaried personnel to apply a bonus for nurses, nursing assistants and beneficiary attendants
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-07-15
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Restricted opening hours for holders of bar permits issued by the Régie des alcools, des courses et des jeux, by changing the time at which bars must stop selling alcoholic beverages to midnight, instead of 3 a.m.; patrons must therefore have left the bar no later than 1 a.m.
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced measures on bars to restrict accommodation capacity to 50% of that listed on the alcohol permit, ban dance activities and require patrons to be seated to consume alcohol
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Mandated masks or face covers in indoor public places for people 12 years of age and older; the public will be prohibited from entering and walking around the following places without wearing a face covering: retail businesses, service companies, private firms of professionals, places where municipal or government services are offered, personal care businesses, shopping centres, places of worship, cinemas, theatres, places used to host events such as conventions and conferences, all common areas of establishments, especially those of office buildings, schools (except elementary and secondary schools), colleges and universities and public transport
Effective until:

Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-07-22
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-07-29
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Prohibited operators of a shared transportation service (bus, minibus, subway, boat, train or plane) to admit a person who is not wearing a face mask or face covering or to tolerate the presence of a person not wearing a mask 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-08-05
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Permitted gatherings of up to 250 people in public outdoor places provided distancing measures are in place; gatherings can consist of events of a social, commercial, religious, cultural, sporting, leisure or entertainment nature, and festivals; the practice of professional sports with a public audience is also permitted, including in public outdoor places
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-08-12
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Ordre des orthophonistes et audiologistes du Québec
What: Released infection and prevention control guidelines for audiologists and speech-language pathologists regarding the mandatory wearing of masks for clients receiving services 
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre des orthophonistes et audiologistes du Québec

description:
Who: Ordre des chiropraticiens du Québec 
What: Released safety guidelines for chiropractors for full return to practice 
Effective until:

Who: Ordre des dentistes du Québec
What: Released interim directives for dental services for Phase 4 of reopening
Effective until:

Who: Ordre des optométristes du Québec
What: Released recommendations and safety guidelines for optometrists for a safe reopening of services
Effective until:

Who: Ordre des pharmaciens du Québec
What: Updated practice guidelines for pharmacy department heads to ensure the safe delivery of pharmaceutical services to elderly residents living in long-term care facilities/nursing homes 
Effective until:

Who: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec 
What: Updated safety guidelines for physiotherapists, including mandatory wearing of face masks for patients and following INSPQ and CNESST safety guidelines 
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec

description:
Who: Ordre professionnel des inhalothérapeutes du Québec
What: Issued safety guidelines for a gradual reopening of non-essential clinical procedures for respiratory therapists
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre professionnel des inhalothérapeutes du Québec

description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced a change in the way the Direction de la santé publique compiles case count data: probable cases identified in hospital laboratories considered confirmed
Effective until:

Who: Institut national de santé publique 
What: Announced application of a new algorithm to better estimate the number of people considered recovered from COVID-19 for whom there is no "recovered" status in the data system and who are not currently hospitalized or deceased
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Office of the minister of education and higher education
What: Announced operational plan for fall reopenings for schools including updates on case management for these institutions: classes will no longer need to be divided into subgroups of a maximum of 6 students; students must maintain a physical distance of 2 metres with members of the school staff and other groups of students but do not need to maintain physical distancing between students within the same classroom; all students must return to in-person learning (exceptions for students with medical conditions or living with someone with a medical condition, who will have distance learning made available to them); masks are mandatory for all students from grade 5 up as well as for all members of the school staff when travelling within the school or on school public transport; masks are not mandatory inside the classroom or cafeterias 
Effective until:
enforcer: Office of the minister of education and higher education

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Office of the minister of education and higher education
What: Announced the release of a guide for COVID-19 case management and spread of COVID-19 in schools by the Institut national de santé publique du Québec outlining steps to follow in cases where a student presents symptoms or obtains a positive COVID-19 test
Effective until:
enforcer: Office of the minister of education and higher education

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-08-19
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Released action plan for the second wave of COVID-19 in order to prepare the health and social services network for upcoming outbreaks: includes the recruitment of workers in long-term care centres, ensuring supply of personal protective equipment by entering into agreements with manufacturers and supporting optimal service offerings in surgery, endoscopy and medical imaging
Effective until:

Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-08-26
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Lifted the suspension of education and instructional services provided by educational institutions
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced the possibility for schools to reduce class hours by 50% for students in grade 10 and 11, provided that distance learning is provided to compensate for reduced hours
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced mandatory masks in indoor public places and transport services now for those age 10 years and older instead of 12 years and older
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Lifted the limit on the number of students allowed in daycares located in schools
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that the government of Quebec will not immediately deploy a contact tracing application for COVID-19 after carrying out public consultations
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-09-02
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that in a place of worship, a distance of 1.5 metres must be maintained between those assembled when they are seated and a distance of 2 metres must be maintained between the minister of religion and the congregation; masks may be removed provided these conditions are met
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that students may remove masks in university facilities, colleges and professional schools when a distance of 1.5 metres is maintained
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced a revision in the self-isolation period for confirmed cases that are considered mild or moderate from 14 days to 10 days after the onset of the first symptoms or, if the person is asymptomatic, 10 days after the date of the positive test for COVID-19
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that the gathering limit of more than 250 people in a public outdoor space does not apply to school centres, school boards or private teaching institutions when they offer services to students in elementary and secondary education
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced the resumption of fights in combat sports such as karate, taekwondo, boxing or judo as long as physical distancing is maintained outside the clashes and training groups of no more than 4 people are created 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-09-09
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced the publication of a list of schools in Quebec that have reported at least one case of COVID-19; this list will be updated daily
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that nursing externs may provide care to a patient in need of rapid intervention without the supervision of the nurse responsible for them
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Unveiled an alert system and regional interventions developed by public health, which will specify, for each region of Quebec, the additional measures to be deployed based on the levels of alert
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-09-16
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that distance learning must be provided within 2 days for students from an educational institution where an isolation order from a public health authority was issued because of a COVID-19 case involving an employee or student 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that individuals refusing to wear masks in indoor public places may be liable to a fine of $400 to $6,000
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced closure of karaoke activities held in public places such as bars and rented or community rooms due to the risk of infection they present
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that bars must keep a register of customers to facilitate contact tracing
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced that 4 regions (Bas-Saint-Laurent, Chaudière-Appalaches, Montréal and Montérégie) entered the yellow early alert zone joining Capitale-Nationale, Laval, Estrie and Outaouais
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced that indoor gatherings must be limited to 10 people or fewer in the regions that are in the yellow early alert zones (Bas-Saint-Laurent, Chaudière-Appalaches, Montréal and Montérégie, Capitale-Nationale, Laval, Estrie and Outaouais)
Effective until:

Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-09-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that nursing homes must maintain a registry of visitors to facilitate contact tracing
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that visitors in private residences for seniors must wear masks in common areas such as an elevator
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced the prohibition of dancing in bars, only allowing alcohol consumption on site between 8 a.m. and midnight and that the maximum capacity be 50% of that allowed 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Office of the minister of education
What: Announced that all school service centres now have a COVID-19 emergency protocol that makes it possible, in the event of a class or school closure, to quickly switch to quality distance education
Effective until:
enforcer: Office of the minister of education

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced an additional $100 per work week in the lump sum to be paid to certain employees of the health network
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that regions of Montréal and Chaudière-Appalaches, as well as a portion of the Capital-Nationale region entered the orange level alert with increased restrictions
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister ofhealth and social services
What: Announced that regions in the orange zones must now limit their private gatherings to a maximum of 6 people or 2 families (households); this number also applies to gatherings at 1 table at bars, restaurants, casinos and gambling dens; a maximum of 25 people may gather in a place of worship and in rooms where events are held and where sale or service of alcohol is given; this may affect activities in rented rooms, festive events, weddings and school celebrations
Effective until:

Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that regions in the orange zones must now limit visits in residential and long-term care centres, and only visits necessary for humanitarian purposes and those of caregivers providing significant help to a resident are allowed
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Launched an appeal to health professionals and retirees such as audiologists, dentists, dietitians-nutritionists, dental hygienists, speech therapists, physiotherapists, nursing assistants, medical technologists and midwives to apply to help with screening efforts for COVID-19
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that medical technology externs may now be allowed to take specimens by introducing an instrument to a peripheral vein according to the regulation respecting the professional activities that may be engaged in by medical technology externs
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-09-30
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that in order to prioritize screening for people at higher risk, screening could be refused to those not in the following priority groups: people who have COVID-19 symptoms and people who have had close contact with someone with COVID-19
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that regions of Montréal, MRC de la Rivière-du-Nord and Chaudière-Appalaches, as well as a portion of the Capital-Nationale region entered the red maximum alert level with increased restrictions
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that gatherings in private homes are prohibited for regions on red alert; only residents of the same address can assemble; exceptions are made for family caregivers, children in shared custody, people offering a service or support or people who are doing construction work already planned; group activities organized in an indoor public place will be prohibited; outside, a physical distance of 2 metres remains the norm
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that for regions on red alert, in seniors' residences, only visits necessary for humanitarian purposes and those of caregivers providing significant help are authorized (1 person at a time and a maximum of 2 people per day in a publicly funded long-term care home)
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
description:
Who: Ordre professionnel des technologistes médicaux du Québec 
What: Modified registration criteria for retired/inactive/graduating medical laboratory technologists to allow them to apply for temporary registration during the pandemic
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre professionnel des technologistes médicaux du Québec

description:
Who: Ordre des dentistes du Québec
What: Published adjustments to dental practices based on alert levels published
Effective until:

Who: Ordre des dentistes du Québec, Ordre des hygiénistes dentaires du Québec 
What: Published guidelines for dental hygienists on resumption of preventive dental services in schools
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre des dentistes du Québec, Ordre des hygiénistes dentaires du Québec

description:
Who: Ordre des pharmaciens du Québec
What: Published new safety measures to reduce risk of infection during vaccination 
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
description:
Who: Ordre professionnel des inhalothérapeutes du Québec
What: Modified temporary registration criteria, authorizing inactive respiratory therapists and/or those who left the profession for less than 5 years to be reinstated
Effective until:
enforcer: Ordre professionnel des inhalothérapeutes du Québec

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Initiated alert system with the province in varied alert zones
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-10-07
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced fines of $1,000 for those refusing to comply with prohibition of gatherings in private residences for individuals not residing at the address for regions in the red zone
Effective until:

Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced fines of $1,000 for those refusing to comply with wearing masks during demonstrations
Effective until:

Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced that Etchemin, Montmagny and Islet sub-regions in Chaudière-Appalaches are turning back to the orange alert level
Effective until:

type: External Border Restrictions or Internal Border Restrictions
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Prohibited travel out of the territories of Municipalité Pointe-à-la-Croix and the Listuguj Community, in the Gaspésie–Îles-de-la-Madeleine health region for residents; prohibited travel also into the region, with exemptions for individuals who have their principal residence there or those who meet order conditions for essential professional or humanitarian purposes
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that the municipalities of Maria, Carleton-sur-Mer and Nouvelle from the Gaspésie region will enter the red alert zone with increased restrictions
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced that the COVID-19 national exposure notification app COVID Alert is now available for the province of Quebec and encouraged Quebecers to download it
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that rules applicable to restaurants and food courts (limit of people per table and distance between tables) do not apply to school cafeterias at preschool, elementary and secondary level, provided that a minimum distance of 2 metres is maintained between students from different groups
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Extended the public health state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-10-14
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced easing of restrictions for visitation for end of life/compassionate reasons in all facilities in all regions of Quebec, regardless of the alert level; partners and kids are now authorized to visit individuals in palliative care without restriction on the number of people who may visit daily; however, only 2 people may be in the room at the same time 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that the MRC de Portneuf in the health region of the Capitale-Nationale and the MRCs of Drummond, Bécancour and Nicolet-Yamaska and the city of Trois-Rivières from the Mauricie et Centre-du-Québec Health Region will enter the red alert zone with increased restrictions
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: External Border Restrictions or Internal Border Restrictions
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced random police checkpoints will be deployed at 5 locations: Laurentides park, petit Laurentides park (route 169), the entrance to La Tuque, La Malbaie coast, Tadoussac ferry; the goal is to protect regions that are still at lower alert levels by limiting non-essential travel
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that Institut national d’excellence en santé et services sociaux released projections for number of hospitalizations and bed occupancy showing that the number of new hospitalizations is increasing for all of Quebec; if the transmission rate remains constant, projections suggest that the number of hospitalized COVID-19 patients will approach planned hospital capacities over the next 4 weeks 
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced the release of a technological solution, which is a self-assessment online tool that will allow Quebecers to book online appointments and receive COVID-19 test results by text message; the solution will reduce the wait time for access to screening, disclose results more quickly and free up thousands of hours of health professionals who can thus be redirected to clinical tasks instead of the administrative tasks they currently perform
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Bas-Saint-Laurent, Chaudière-Appalaches, Montréal and Montérégie, indoor, outdoor and private home gatherings are allowed for a maximum of 10 people
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Bas-Saint-Laurent, Chaudière-Appalaches, Montréal and Montérégie in the yellow level, performance halls, cinemas, theatres, museums and places of worship may accommodate 250 people; a maximum of 50 people per room is allowed for funerals and for activities organized in a public indoor space (such as rented room, weddings); for such activities outdoors, 250 people are permitted to gather
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Bas-Saint-Laurent, Chaudière-Appalaches, Montréal and Montérégie in the yellow level, bars, brasseries, taverns, casinos and restaurant dining rooms are permitted to have 10 people per table; bars, brasseries, taverns and casinos will be open at 50% capacity: alcohol sales end at midnight, dancing is prohibited and business must close at 1 a.m.; a customer registry must be maintained
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Bas-Saint-Laurent, Chaudière-Appalaches, Montréal and Montérégie in the yellow alert, all organized leisure and sports: will permit a maximum of 250 people for outdoor activities and 50 people for indoor activities; independent practice in a closed outdoor or indoor area will be permitted for 50 people
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Bas-Saint-Laurent, Chaudière-Appalaches, Montréal and Montérégie, in seniors' residences (CHSLDs), a maximum of 2 people at a time for a maximum of 4 people per 24 hours may visit; in a seniors' private residence (RPA), a maximum of 10 people at a time are allowed in a unit
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Montréal and Chaudière-Appalaches, as well as a portion of the Capitale-Nationale region, indoor, outdoor and private home gatherings are allowed for a maximum of 6 people
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Montréal and Chaudière-Appalaches, as well as a portion of the Capitale-Nationale region in the orange level, performance halls, cinemas, theatres, museums and places of worship may accommodate 250 people; a maximum of 25 people per room is allowed for funerals and for activities organized in a public indoor or outdoor space (such as rented rooms, weddings, picnics, organized leisure and sports)
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Montréal and Chaudière-Appalaches, as well as a portion of the Capitale-Nationale region in the orange level, bars, brasseries, taverns, casinos and restaurant dining rooms are permitted to have 6 people per table; alcohol sales end at 11 p.m., dancing is prohibited and business must close at midnight; a customer registry must be maintained
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Montréal and Chaudière-Appalaches, as well as a portion of the Capitale-Nationale region, in seniors' residences (CHSLDs), only visits necessary for humanitarian purposes and those of caregivers providing significant help are authorized; in a seniors' private residence (RPA), a maximum of 6 people at a time are allowed in a unit
Effective until:
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Montréal, MRC de la Rivière-du-Nord and Chaudière-Appalaches, as well as a portion of the Capitale-Nationale region, gatherings are prohibited in private homes, indoor and outdoor places; only residents of the same address can assemble; exceptions are made for family caregivers, children in shared custody, people offering a service or support or people who are doing construction work already planned
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of education
What: For regions of the MRC de Portneuf in the health region of the Capitale-Nationale and the MRCs of Drummond, Bécancour and Nicolet-Yamaska and the city of Trois-Rivières from the Mauricie et Centre-du-Québec Health Region in the red level, it is now mandatory for schools to reduce class hours by 50% for students in grades 10 and 11 and provide distance learning to compensate for reduced hours. Wearing of a face covering will be compulsory at all times for students attending a secondary school, including on the grounds outside the establishments and inside the classroom. A procedural mask is also compulsory for all school staff in common areas, particularly at all times in staff rooms (except for eating or drinking) and on the school grounds if they cannot respect the 2-metre distance. Students must return to a single stable class group at all times. Extracurricular and inter-school activities as well as school trips will be suspended. Only activities carried out in free practice, on an individual basis or in pairs, will be permitted. No group activity, match or competition will be allowed.
Effective until: 2020-11-23

What: For regions of Montérégie, the MRCs of Charlevoix and Charlevoix-Est in the Capitale-Nationale health region, and the MRCs of Arthabaska and Érable from the health region of Centre-du-Québec, which are in the red level, performance halls, cinemas, theatres, museums and libraries not part of an educational institution will be closed; exceptions allowed for places of worship and for funerals, but accommodating a maximum of 25 people; activities organized in a public place are prohibited; all organized leisure and sports, outside the school context, must be suspended; prohibited are group lessons and supervised sports practice; training rooms and fitness centres will be closed
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Montérégie, the MRCs of Charlevoix and Charlevoix-Est in the Capitale-Nationale health region, and the MRCs of Arthabaska and Érable from the health region of Centre-du-Québec, which are in the red level, bars, brasseries, taverns and casinos will be closed as well as restaurant dining rooms (only delivery and takeout orders will be allowed); saunas and spas will be closed except for personal care
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: For regions of Montérégie, the MRCs of Charlevoix and Charlevoix-Est in the Capitale-Nationale health region, and the MRCs of Arthabaska and Érable from the health region of Centre-du-Québec, in seniors' residences (CHSLDs), only visits necessary for humanitarian purposes and those of caregivers providing significant help are authorized (1 person at a time and a maximum of 2 people per day in a publicly funded long-term care home)
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings

description:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that for regions of Centre-du-Québec and the entire health region of Mauricie in the red level, it is now mandatory for schools to reduce class hours by 50% for students in grades 10 and 11 and provide distance learning to compensate for reduced hours. Wearing of a face covering will be compulsory at all times for students attending a secondary school, including on the grounds outside the establishments and inside the classroom. A procedural mask is also compulsory for all school staff in common areas, particularly at all times in staff rooms (except for eating or drinking) and on the school grounds if they cannot respect the 2-metre distance. Students must return to a single stable class group at all times. Extracurricular and inter-school activities as well as school trips will be suspended. Only activities carried out in free practice, on an individual basis or in pairs, will be permitted. No group activity, match or competition will be allowed.
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)

What: Announced that for the region of Estrie in the red level, bars, brasseries, taverns and casinos will be closed as well as restaurant dining rooms (only delivery and takeout orders will be allowed); saunas and spas will be closed except for personal care
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that for the region of Estrie, in seniors' residences (CHSLDs), only visits necessary for humanitarian purposes and those of caregivers providing significant help are authorized (1 person at a time and a maximum of 2 people per day in a publicly funded long-term care home)
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Minister of health and social services
What: Announced that for the region of Estrie in the red level, it is now mandatory for schools to reduce class hours by 50% for students in grades 10 and 11 and provide distance learning to compensate for reduced hours. Wearing of a face covering will be compulsory at all times for students attending a secondary school, including on the grounds outside the establishments and inside the classroom. A procedural mask is also compulsory for all school staff in common areas, particularly at all times in staff rooms (except for eating or drinking) and on the school grounds if they cannot respect the 2-metre distance. Students must return to a single stable class group at all times. Extracurricular and inter-school activities as well as school trips will be suspended. Only activities carried out in free practice, on an individual basis or in pairs, will be permitted. No group activity, match or competition will be allowed.
Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:

Effective until: 2020-11-23
enforcer: Minister of health and social services

description:
Who: Ministry of health and social services

enforcer: Ministry of health and social services

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings

Effective until:
enforcer: Ministry of health and social services

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Ministry of health and social services
What: The regions of Chapais and Chibougamau moved to the maximum alert–red level: permitted 1 stable class group to limit social contact in preschools and elementary schools; suspended all extracurricular, inter-school activities as well as field trips in all schools; activities carried out in free practice, on an individual basis or in pairs, permitted; prohibited group activities, matches or competitions; mandated wearing of face coverings at all times for secondary school students, including on the grounds outside the establishments and inside the classroom; a procedural mask is also compulsory for all preschool, elementary and secondary school staff in common areas, particularly at all times in staff rooms (except for eating or drinking) and on the school grounds if they cannot respect the 2-metre distance; reduced class hours by 50% for students in grades 9 to 11 and mandated distance learning for remaining 50% of the time 
Effective until:
enforcer: Ministry of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Ministry of health and social services
What: The regions of Chapais and Chibougamau moved to the maximum alert–red level: prohibited gatherings in homes and other private indoor and outdoor places; only residents of the same address can assemble, with exceptions for family caregivers, children in shared custody, people offering a service or support or labour for planned work; individuals living alone may have a single visitor, recommended as 1 exclusive close contact; prohibited gatherings for publicly organized activities; limited places of worship and funerals to a maximum of 25 people excluding workers and volunteers; an attendance register must be kept
Effective until:
enforcer: Ministry of health and social services

type: External Border Restrictions or Internal Border Restrictions
description:

type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
Who: Ministry of health and social services
What: Prioritized the groups to be vaccinated as follows: vulnerable people with a great loss of autonomy who reside in residential and long-term care centres (CHSLDs) or in intermediate and family-type resources (RI-RTF); workers in the health and social services network in contact with users; autonomous people or people with a loss of autonomy who live in private seniors' residences (RPA) or in certain closed areas housing the elderly; isolated and remote communities; people age 80 or older; people age 70 to 79; people age 60 to 69; adults under the age of 60 who have a chronic illness or health problem that increases the risk of complications from COVID-19; adults under 60 without chronic diseases or health problems increasing the risk of complications, but who provide essential services and who are in contact with users; the rest of the adult population
Effective until:
enforcer: Ministry of health and social services

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: For all regions of Quebec, prohibited gatherings in homes and other private indoor places; only residents of the same address can assemble, with exceptions for family caregivers, children in shared custody, people offering a service or support or labour for planned work; individuals living alone may join a family bubble; outdoor gatherings are allowed for a maximum of 8 people for outdoor activities; limited places of worship and funerals to a maximum of 25 people excluding workers and volunteers; an attendance register must be kept
Effective until: 2021-01-10

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings

Effective until: 2021-01-10

description:
Who: Office of the Premier
What: Announced that all regions of Quebec, with the exception of Nunavik and Terres-Cries-de-la-Baie-James, will be subject to a curfew between the hours of 8 p.m. and 5 a.m.; exceptions made for those working during curfew hours, those who have a medical appointment or need to get medication from a pharmacy; fines will be given out to those not respecting the curfew
Effective until: 2021-02-08

description:
Who: Saskatchewan Senior Medical Health Officer
What: Testing is recommended for individuals with symptoms compatible with COVID-19 AND symptom onset within 14 days of exposure: travel outside Canada, including United States; travel within Canada to B.C., Alta., Ont., Que.; travel within Canada to any province and attended a mass gathering; health care workers (including but not limited to Saskatchewan Health Authority staff); prioritize for same day testing, but not until >24 hours after symptom onset (to minimize false negatives); contacts of cases, even if case was reported outside of Saskatchewan; hospitalized with respiratory illness, especially if no other cause; consider repeat testing if initial test negative; outbreaks in long-term care facilities
Effective until:

What: Waived or modified registration requirements for former registered nurses and nurse practitioners, allowing them to apply for temporary registration during the pandemic on an expedited basis and at no cost. Licence to be valid for 90 days with opportunity for extension as needed.
Effective until:

Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Self-isolation is required for 14 days after returning from travel outside Canada; for individuals who have been in close contact with a person with COVID-19; and for individuals who are diagnosed with COVID-19 and well enough to stay at home. 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Closure of elementary, middle and high schools; suspension of classes
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Tourism Saskatchewan
What: Closed in-person park facility services
Effective until:

Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Travellers returning to Sask. from outside Canada are required to self-isolate for 14 days. Violation of the order may result in a $2,000 fine. Anyone identified as a close contact of someone with COVID-19 is required to self-isolate for 14 days from date of contact.
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Child care centres co-located in schools will remain operational and open spaces exclusively to workers who are associated with the pandemic responses who need child care during the COVID-19 pandemic. 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Published case definition, which aligns with the national case definition
Effective until:

Who: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer; Work Safe Saskatchewan
What: Announced that all non-essential employees in Government of Saskatchewan ministries, agencies and Crown corporations will be part of a phased-in work-from-home policy. This requires any employee able to work from home to do so immediately. All non-government workers are encouraged to work from home where possible.
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer; Work Safe Saskatchewan

description:
Who: Saskatchewan Health Authority
What: Discontinued all non-urgent/elective surgeries, procedures and diagnostics.
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Tourism Saskatchewan
What: Closed park facilities (all person-staffed buildings and desks, visitor centres, washrooms, picnic areas, as well as campgrounds and campsites)
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer
What: Services ordered closed and only allowed delivery/takeout: restaurants, food courts, cafeterias, cafes, bistros and similar facilities. Exceptions are takeout with 2-metre distancing between customers during pickup; drive-through food services; delivery of food products; soup kitchens, not-for-profit community and religious kitchens with 2-metre distancing between tables. Closures of all personal service facilities including tattooists, hairdressers, barbers, cosmetologists, electrologists, estheticians, manicurists, pedicurists, suntanning parlours, facilities performing body piercing, bone grafting or scarification services. 
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer

type: Health Resources or Restriction and Regulation of Businesses
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer
What: Ordered closure of dental, optometrist, chiropractic, physical therapists, registered massage therapy, acupuncturists, acupressurists and podiatry clinics except for non-elective procedures
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer

type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Daycare facilities limited to maximum of 8 children unless they can configure the facility so that a maximum of 8 children are kept in room and be in accordance with the Saskatchewan child care guidelines for care. All daycares that are co-located with a long-term care or personal care home that meet the above restriction shall be segregated with a private entrance so that there are no shared common areas with the home and no interaction between daycare children and residents of the facility.
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Launched a phone line to answer non-health-specific COVID-19 questions (e.g., travel restrictions) 
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer
What: Updated list of services and workers deemed essential. Services and businesses now considered non-essential and ordered to only allow pickup/delivery: clothing stores; shoe stores; flower shops; sporting good and adventure stores; vaping supply shops; boats, ATV or snowmobile retailers; gift, book or stationary stores; jewelry and accessory stores; toy stores; music, electronic and entertainment stores; pawn shops; and travel agencies.
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer
What: Prohibited gatherings of more than 10 people
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Saskatchewan, Chief Medical Health Officer

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
description:
Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: Redeployed government staff to address capacity need for contact tracing
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Tourism Saskatchewan
What: Suspended campsite reservation, and opening suspended
Effective until:

Who: Government of Saskatchewan
What: All critically ill patients are suspected to be COVID-19 positive until proven otherwise. Assessing for signs of life can no longer include listening or feeling for breathing by placing your ear and cheek close to the patient’s mouth.
Effective until:

Who: Métis Nation – Saskatchewan
What: Provided $2.88 million, with $110,000 to each of the 12 MN-S regions, as the first relief response of COVID-19. This interim funding provides some relief for the immediate needs for Métis families in the area of child care, personal protective equipment, regional capacity and Métis households in financial distress. Funding breakdowns include the following:
• MN-S Emergency Housing Support Program: $500 maximum per Métis household
• MN-S Childcare Support: 1-time funding of $500 per child 
• MN-S Personal Protective Equipment Program: Regions will prioritize the delivery of personal protective equipment supplies to at-risk citizens
Effective until:

Who: Government of Saskatchewan, Saskatchewan Health Authority
What: Released projections for cases and critical care capacity
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Saskatchewan, Saskatchewan Health Authority

description:

What: Spring breaks in Sask. regions follow the same schedule. Saskatoon Public Schools example provided.
Effective until: 2020-04-17

Who: Saskatchewan Health Authority (SHA)
What: Mandated daily screening of staff, physicians, learners, trainees, vendors and contractors before entering any SHA facility (including long-term care facilities, hospitals, primary care sites) or program area, to ensure they do not have any influenza-like illness
Effective until:

Who: Saskatchewan Health Authority
What: Mandated that staff and physicians who work in patient/client/resident care areas or travel through those areas must wear a mask at all times 
Effective until:

Who: Regional medical health officers

Effective until:

type: External Border Restrictions or Internal Border Restrictions
description:

What: Advised against all non-essential travel between northwest Saskatchewan and northern Alberta. This is in response to cases linked to travel between northwest Saskatchewan and Alberta, and reports of a number of COVID-19 cases identified at an oil sands facility north of Fort McMurray.
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

enforcer: Ministry of Health, Saskatchewan Health Authority

description:

What: Increased Yukon border restrictions have been introduced using the new Border Control Measures Order under the Civil Emergency Measures Act. This order details in exactly what situations people can enter Yukon: Yukon residents; non-resident family members of Yukon residents; delivering a critical or essential service; transiting through Yukon to a neighbouring jurisdiction (24-hour limitation); or exercising an Aboriginal or treaty right (for the time needed to exercise the right).

description:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Announced that retail operations may open as long as they have a plan in place to service the public safely, but bars, restaurants, recreation and personal services remain closed under the public health order. Businesses should consult cleaning guidelines on Yukon.ca.
Effective until:

What: Announced that hospitals will resume some elective and non-urgent procedures on a limited basis. These services include elective surgeries, blood work and imaging.
Effective until:

description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Announced that hospitals will resume visits with physiotherapists, occupational therapists and some specialists
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Announced that Yukoners can camp on public land for recreational purposes but recommends that people do not camp with more than 10 people and those who are outside their immediately family, and to maintain physical distance of 2 metres. Territorial and national park campgrounds remain closed.
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Released projections on cases and critical care capacity 
Effective until:

What: Issued Civil Emergency Measures Self-Isolation Exception for Traditional Activities order to allow Indigenous people to enter Yukon and exercise their treaty rights without mandatory self-isolation
Effective until:
enforcer: Government of Yukon, Minister of Community Services

description:
Who: Government of Yukon

Effective until:

Effective until:

What: Released territorial reopening plan entitled "A Path Forward"
Effective until:

description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Permitted all Canadians to enter Yukon, with strict public health measures in place; formed a travel bubble with B.C., N.W.T. and Nun., allowing residents from those jurisdictions to enter without restrictions 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Formed a travel bubble with B.C., N.W.T. and Nun. allowing residents of these regions to enter Yukon without self-isolating for 14 days; travellers must not have travelled outside these 4 regions in the past 14 days; all other Canadian travellers permitted to enter Yukon must self-isolate for 14 days     
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings

What: Permitted public swimming pools to open

Effective until:

What: All regions entered Phase 2 of the "A Path Forward" reopening plan.  
Effective until: 2020-07-31

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Opened Whitehorse Public Library for in-person services 
Effective until:

What: Announced gradual return of government employees to working from the office
Effective until:

What: All regions entered Phase 3 of the "A Path Forward" reopening plan.  
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Expanded testing criteria to include a broader range of symptoms for individuals who have not travelled: fever, chills, cough, shortness of breath, runny nose, sore throat, loss of sense of taste or smell, headache, fatigue, loss of appetite, nausea and vomiting, diarrhea and muscle aches
Effective until:

What: Mandated the use of non-medical masks at all Yukon airports, including the terminals

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:

What: Expanded household bubbles to include an additional 3 to 5 families, to a maximum of 15 people; permitted seated events in rental spaces of up to 50 people and seated outdoor events of up to 100 people with distancing measures in place; indoor social gathering limits remained at 10 people, if all members are not in a bubble  
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Permitted music, including singing and wind instruments, in bars, pubs and lounges if requirements are met, which include a physical distance between musicians and patrons 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Released plan for K-12 students to return to school full time in the fall; options for blended learning and considerations for rural and First Nations students are included; masks are not required to be worn by children and are optional for staff; physical distancing will be implemented where possible, with 2 metres between students
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Released safety guidelines for rural community nursing health centres, including best practices to be followed at all stages of an appointment 
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Permitted karaoke for solo performers and groups; performers must be screened for illness prior to performing
Effective until:

What: Extended the territorial state of emergency
Effective until: 2020-12-12

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Recommended that children age 10 and older wear masks in school, where distancing is not possible and on buses; required schools to submit an operational plan for review and left the decision up to each school about mask wearing policies 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Permitted residents in long-term care homes to have 2 designated visitors indoors; allowed an additional 2 designated visitors for outside visits, in addition to the 1 previously designated outdoor visitor 
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Children exhibiting any of the symptoms (fever and/or chills, cough, shortness of breath, decrease or loss of smell or taste, sore throat, stuffy and/or runny nose, headache, nausea, vomiting and/or diarrhea, fatigue, lethargy, muscle aches or malaise) have to self-isolate at home for 14 days or test negative for COVID-19 before returning to school or daycare; children who test negative for COVID-19 may return to school when they have been free of fever for 24 hours or when other symptoms are improving
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Released final plan for reopening all schools in Yukon: the majority of Yukon schools are able to return all students to full-time classes 5 days per week, except for the 3 larger Whitehorse high schools, where students up to grade 9 will return for full-day classes 5 days a week and grades 10 to 12 will return for half-day in-person and half-day online
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Reopened first elementary, middle and high schools for in-person learning; student return dates vary by region, with the majority returning August 20 and the last returning September 2
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:

What: Reopened Yukon's post-secondary institution, Yukon University, for a mix of online and in-person classes; some facilities opened in-person on September 4
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
description:
Who: Government of Yukon
What: Released plan with safety guidance for K-12 students to return to school full time in the fall: school staff will screen for symptoms using the provincial screening criteria; students with prolonged absences will be flagged to ensure no symptoms during time off 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Phase 0 of the "A Path Forward" reopening plan backdated to the start of the pandemic
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings

Effective until:

description:

type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below), Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18), Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)

type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
description:

What: Re-enacted temporary emergency registration protocols for registered nurses and nurse practitioners
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Opened drive-through assessment centre in Whitehorse for individuals experiencing symptoms of COVID-19; no assessment centre had been open in the territory since May 31, 2020 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Permitted residents in long-term care homes to have 4 designated visitors, with 2 visitors at a time who are part of the same social bubble
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Required all travellers entering Yukon to self-isolate for 14 days, with the exception of critical service workers, residents of Atlin, Lower Post, Fireside, Jade City, Good Hope Lake, Fraser or Pleasant Camp and those exercising an Aboriginal or treaty right; this included residents of B.C., N.W.T. and Nun. 
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Mandated that masks are worn in all indoor public spaces for all people over the age of 5; some exemptions for people who are unable to wear a mask due to psychological, behavioural or other pre-existing health conditions
Effective until:

Who: Government of Yukon
What: Introduced a self-isolation option for residents with guests from outside of Yukon during the holiday season; permitted residents to have close contact with guests, provided all members of the household self-isolate for 14 days; if the guests leave Yukon before 14 days are up, the resident must continue to self-isolate for 3 days
Effective until:

type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time

description:

Who: Public Health Agency of Canada
What: Announced an investment of $2.25 million for 2 projects, ScienceUp First and CARD (C-Comfort, A-Ask, R-Relax, D-Distract) System, to support vaccination efforts. The projects support vaccine uptake by providing access to credible information and equipping health care providers and Canadians with proven strategies to manage pain and fear during vaccination. 
Effective until:

description:

description:

Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Manitoba
What: Announced that all households may have only 2 designated visitors indoors; limited outdoor gatherings on public and private property to a maximum of 10 people including household members; weddings and funerals reduced to 10 people (in addition to an officiant and photographer)
Effective until:

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Manitoba
What: Announced that retail stores must be limited to one-third the capacity of the store or up to 333 patrons, whichever is lower, and malls will be limited to 33% of the facility’s capacity; faith-based gatherings limited to 25% capacity or 50 people
Effective until: 2021-05-12

Who: Government of Manitoba
What: Permitted vaccinated personal care home staff and agency staff to provide care at more than one site
Effective until:

Who: Government of Manitoba
What: Non-medical masks must be worn outside the home in Chemawawin Cree Nation
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:

What: Prohibited public gatherings and required community residents to stay at home, leaving only for essential reasons, in Chemawawin Cree Nation 
Effective until:

type: Restrictions of Mass Gatherings or Social Distancing
description:
Who: Government of Manitoba
What: Announced no visitors will be allowed to private households either indoors or outdoors with certain exceptions including allowing 1 visitor for people who live alone; no indoor gatherings will be permitted, and outdoor gatherings of up to 10 people will be allowed in public outdoor spaces only
Effective until: 2021-05-26

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Manitoba
What: Announced food courts in malls and shopping centres are required to close; patio dining restricted to groups of 4 people only with no household restrictions; retail stores limited to 25% of the capacity of the store or up to 250 patrons, whichever is lower, and malls limited to 25% capacity; personal service business allowed to continue to operate at 50% capacity, but appointments required; faith-based gatherings limited to 25% capacity or a maximum of 10 people, whichever is lower
Effective until: 2021-05-26

type: Restriction and Regulation of Businesses or Restriction and Regulation of Government Services or Restrictions of Mass Gatherings
description:
Who: Government of Manitoba
What: Announced dance, theatre and music facilities will continue to be limited to 25%, but the new orders will limit the maximum number of people on site to 10; gyms and fitness centres continue to be limited to 25% capacity, but individuals, patrons and staff will be required to maintain physical distancing of 3 metres from others 
Effective until: 2021-05-26

type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping, storage, administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
description:
